title: Change the Remote URL
description: In Git, a remote is a version of your repository that is hosted on a server or another computer. When you clone a repository, Git automatically creates a remote called origin that points to the original repository. However, sometimes you may need to change the URL of the remote repository. This lab will test your ability to change the remote URL using Git commands.

meta.title: Change the Remote URL in Git
meta.description: Learn how to change the remote URL of a Git repository using commands.
